name: smofvon
body: |- wi(wa(wsmo(c0), wcel(c1, cdm(c0))), wcel(cfv(c0, c1), con0))

body.origin:
|- wi(wa(wsmo(c0), wcel(c1, cdm(c0))), wcel(cfv(c0, c1), con0))
-| wi(wsmo(c0), wf(c0, cdm(c0), con0))
body.pretty:
⊢ ((Smo(c0)∧ c1 ∈ dom(c0))→(c0 ` c1)∈ On)
⊣ (Smo(c0)→(c0 : dom(c0)→ On))

comment: If ` B ` is a strictly monotone ordinal function, and ` A ` is in the domain of ` B ` , then the value of the function at ` A ` is an ordinal. (Contributed by Andrew Salmon, 20-Nov-2011.)
